name: kettlebell goblet squat
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell close to your chest with both hands.
Step 2: Keeping your chest up and core engaged, lower your body down into a squat position by bending at the knees and hips.
Step 3: Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever chest press
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the machine with your back flat against the pad.
Step 2: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and position your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
Step 3: Push the handles forward until your arms are fully extended, exhaling during the movement.
Step 4: Pause briefly at the end of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position, inhaling as you do so.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell incline biceps curl
instructions: Step 1: Sit on an incline bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward, and arms fully extended.
Step 2: Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step 3: Continue to raise the dumbbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step 4: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step 5: Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: close-grip push-up
instructions: Step 1: Start in a high plank position with your hands placed close together, directly under your shoulders.
Step 2: Engage your core and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Step 3: Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
Step 4: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell side bend
instructions: Step 1: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in one hand, letting it hang down by your side.
Step 2: Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, slowly bend sideways at the waist towards the opposite side of the dumbbell, lowering the weight as far as you comfortably can.
Step 3: Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step 4: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat.

name: archer pull up
instructions: Step 1: Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Engage your core and pull your shoulder blades down and back.
Step 3: As you pull yourself up, bend one arm and bring your elbow towards your side, while keeping the other arm straight.
Step 4: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar and your bent arm is fully flexed.
Step 5: Lower yourself back down with control, straightening the bent arm and repeating the movement on the other side.
Step 6: Alternate sides with each repetition.

name: cable one arm tricep pushdown
instructions: Step 1: Stand facing a cable machine with a straight bar attachment at chest height.
Step 2: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip and step back to create tension in the cable.
Step 3: Position your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly bend your knees.
Step 4: Keep your back straight and core engaged throughout the exercise.
Step 5: Start with your arm fully extended and perpendicular to the floor.
Step 6: Keeping your upper arm stationary, exhale and push the bar down until your arm is fully extended.
Step 7: Pause for a moment, then inhale and slowly return to the starting position.
Step 8: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

name: stationary bike
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position to ensure proper alignment.
Step 2: Place your feet on the pedals and secure them with the straps if available.
Step 3: Start pedaling at a comfortable pace.
Step 4: Maintain a steady rhythm and increase the resistance as desired.
Step 5: Engage your core muscles to maintain stability and proper posture.
Step 6: Continue pedaling for the desired duration of your workout.
Step 7: Gradually decrease the resistance and slow down before coming to a complete stop.
Step 8: Stretch your legs and cool down after the workout.

name: dumbbell seated biceps curl
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing up.
Step 2: Rest your upper arms on your thighs, allowing the dumbbells to hang down.
Step 3: Keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders by contracting your biceps.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: hip abductor
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height so that your knees are at a 90-degree angle.
Step 2: Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and your feet on the footrests.
Step 3: Place your hands on the side handles for stability.
Step 4: Engage your abductors and slowly push your legs apart, away from the midline of your body.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the end of the movement, then slowly bring your legs back together to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: chest dip on straight bar
instructions: Step 1: Grab the parallel bars with your palms facing down and your arms fully extended.
Step 2: Bend your knees and cross your ankles.
Step 3: Lower your body by bending your arms until your shoulders are below your elbows.
Step 4: Push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell front raise and pullover
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
Step 2: Keep your arms straight and raise the barbell in front of you until it reaches shoulder height.
Step 3: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step 4: Next, lower the barbell behind your head, keeping your arms straight.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then raise the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell clean and press
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell on the floor in front of you.
Step 2: Bend your knees and hinge at the hips to lower down and grip the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Drive through your heels and extend your hips and knees to lift the barbell off the floor, keeping it close to your body.
Step 4: As the barbell reaches your thighs, explosively extend your hips, shrug your shoulders, and pull the barbell up towards your chest.
Step 5: As the barbell reaches chest height, quickly drop under it and catch it at shoulder level, with your elbows pointing forward and your palms facing up.
Step 6: From the catch position, press the barbell overhead by extending your arms and pushing the barbell straight up.
Step 7: Lower the barbell back down to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell wrist curl
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your forearms resting on your thighs, holding a barbell with an underhand grip.
Step 2: Allow the barbell to roll down to your fingertips, keeping your wrists straight.
Step 3: Slowly curl the barbell up towards your forearms by flexing your wrists.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: inverted row bent knees
instructions: Step 1: Set up a bar at waist height and lie underneath it.
Step 2: Grab the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Position your body so that your heels are on the ground and your body is straight.
Step 4: Pull your chest up towards the bar by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell reverse grip incline bench row
instructions: Step 1: Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step 2: Sit on the bench facing the backrest with your chest against it.
Step 3: Grab the barbell with a reverse grip (palms facing down) and hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 4: Keep your back straight and core engaged.
Step 5: Pull the barbell towards your upper abdomen, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the top of the movement.
Step 7: Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step 8: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith narrow row
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the machine with your feet flat on the floor.
Step 2: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Keep your back straight and your chest up as you pull the handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the peak of the movement, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: preacher curl machine
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the machine with your upper arms resting on the pad and your chest against the support.
Step 2: Grasp the handles with an underhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Keep your upper arms stationary and exhale as you curl the handles towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
Step 5: Inhale as you slowly lower the handles back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable external rotation
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step 2: Hold the cable handle with your arm extended in front of you, parallel to the ground.
Step 3: Keep your elbow slightly bent and your shoulder blades pulled back.
Step 4: Slowly rotate your arm outward, away from your body, while keeping your elbow in the same position.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the end of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: handstand
instructions: Step 1: Find an open space with enough room to perform a handstand.
Step 2: Place your hands on the ground shoulder-width apart, fingers pointing forward.
Step 3: Kick your legs up towards the wall, using your core and shoulders to maintain balance.
Step 4: Once in a handstand position, engage your triceps to support your body weight.
Step 5: Hold the handstand for as long as you can maintain balance.
Step 6: To come down, slowly lower your legs back to the ground.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: full planche push-up
instructions: Step 1: Start in a push-up position with your hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Engage your core and lower your body down towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Step 3: As you lower yourself, lean your body forward and lift your feet off the ground, balancing on your hands.
Step 4: Continue to lower your body until your chest is just above the ground.
Step 5: Push through your hands and extend your arms to lift your body back up to the starting position.
Step 6: Maintain a straight line from your head to your heels throughout the movement.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell lying external shoulder rotation
instructions: Step 1: Lie on your side on a flat bench with your upper arm against your side and your elbow bent 90 degrees.
Step 2: Hold a dumbbell in your hand with your palm facing down.
Step 3: Keeping your upper arm against your side, slowly rotate your forearm upward as far as possible.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your forearm back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: ez barbell seated triceps extension
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step 2: Hold the ez barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Raise the barbell overhead, fully extending your arms.
Step 4: Keeping your upper arms stationary, lower the barbell behind your head by bending your elbows.
Step 5: Pause for a moment, then raise the barbell back to the starting position by extending your arms.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell straight leg deadlift
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
Step 2: Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, hinge at the hips and lower the dumbbells towards the ground, allowing your torso to lean forward.
Step 3: Continue lowering the dumbbells until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, keeping your knees slightly bent.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then engage your glutes and hamstrings to lift your torso back up to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith close-grip bench press
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
Step 2: Grasp the barbell with a close grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Lower the barbell towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable seated crunch
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a cable machine with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
Step 2: Hold the cable handle with both hands and position it behind your head.
Step 3: Engage your abs and slowly curl your upper body forward, bringing your chest towards your knees.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: suspended push-up
instructions: Step 1: Find a suspension trainer and adjust it to an appropriate height.
Step 2: Stand facing away from the anchor point and hold the handles with an overhand grip.
Step 3: Walk your feet forward, leaning your body forward until your weight is supported by the suspension trainer.
Step 4: Keep your body straight from head to heels, engage your core, and lower your chest towards the handles.
Step 5: Push through your chest and arms to return to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell preacher hammer curl
instructions: Step 1: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso.
Step 2: Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward.
Step 3: This will be your starting position.
Step 4: Now, keeping the upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step 5: Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step 6: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step 7: Then, inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step 8: Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: cable front raise
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and grasp the cable handle with an overhand grip.
Step 2: Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
Step 3: Raise the cable handle in front of you, keeping your arms straight and your palms facing down.
Step 4: Continue lifting until your arms are parallel to the floor.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the cable handle back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: kettlebell alternating press
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a kettlebell in each hand at shoulder height.
Step 2: Press one kettlebell overhead, fully extending your arm.
Step 3: Lower the kettlebell back to shoulder height.
Step 4: Repeat with the other arm.
Step 5: Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable alternate triceps extension
instructions: Step 1: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Hold the cable handle with your right hand and bring your arm up so that your upper arm is parallel to the ground and your elbow is bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step 3: Keep your upper arm stationary and extend your forearm backward, fully straightening your arm.
Step 4: Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat with your left arm.
Step 6: Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable overhead tricep extension
instructions: Step 1: Attach a rope to a high pulley and adjust the weight accordingly.
Step 2: Stand facing away from the pulley machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing down, and bring your hands above your head.
Step 4: Keep your upper arms close to your head and perpendicular to the floor.
Step 5: Slowly lower the rope behind your head by bending your elbows.
Step 6: Pause for a moment, then extend your arms back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell incline row
instructions: Step 1: Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step 2: Lie face down on the bench with your chest against the pad and your feet flat on the ground.
Step 3: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 4: Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
Step 5: Pull the barbell towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell single leg deadlift
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, holding a dumbbell in your right hand.
Step 2: Shift your weight onto your left leg and lift your right foot slightly off the ground.
Step 3: Keeping your back straight, hinge forward at the hips and lower the dumbbell towards the ground.
Step 4: At the same time, extend your right leg straight behind you, maintaining a slight bend in your left knee.
Step 5: Lower the dumbbell until your torso and right leg are parallel to the ground.
Step 6: Pause for a moment, then engage your glutes and hamstrings to return to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: barbell standing close grip curl
instructions: Step 1: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, hands close together.
Step 2: Keep your elbows close to your torso and your upper arms stationary throughout the movement.
Step 3: Exhale as you curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue to raise the bar until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Step 4: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step 5: Inhale as you slowly begin to bring the barbell back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted front plank
instructions: Step 1: Start by lying face down on the floor.
Step 2: Place your forearms on the ground, with your elbows directly under your shoulders.
Step 3: Extend your legs straight out behind you, with your toes on the ground.
Step 4: Engage your core and lift your body off the ground, balancing on your forearms and toes.
Step 5: Keep your body in a straight line from your head to your heels.
Step 6: Hold this position for the desired amount of time.
Step 7: Lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step 8: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever front pulldown
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the machine with your knees under the pads and your feet flat on the ground.
Step 2: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Sit upright with your chest lifted and your shoulders back, maintaining a slight arch in your lower back.
Step 4: Engage your lats and pull the handles down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: assisted hanging knee raise
instructions: Step 1: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step 2: Engage your core muscles and lift your knees towards your chest, bending at the hips and knees.
Step 3: Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your abs.
Step 4: Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith incline shoulder raises
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the smith machine to an incline position.
Step 2: Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 4: Keep your back straight and core engaged.
Step 5: Raise the barbell up towards the ceiling, leading with your elbows.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: sphinx
instructions: Step 1: Lie face down on the ground with your forearms flat on the floor, elbows directly under your shoulders.
Step 2: Engage your core and lift your chest off the ground, keeping your forearms and toes on the floor.
Step 3: Hold this position for a few seconds, making sure to keep your neck in a neutral position.
Step 4: Slowly lower your chest back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell bench squat
instructions: Step 1: Set up a barbell on a squat rack at chest height.
Step 2: Stand facing away from the rack, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Bend your knees and lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight and chest up.
Step 4: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 5: Lift the barbell off the rack and step back, ensuring your feet are still shoulder-width apart.
Step 6: Lower your body down into a squat, keeping your knees in line with your toes.
Step 7: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step 8: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: bodyweight kneeling triceps extension
instructions: Step 1: Kneel down on the ground with your knees hip-width apart.
Step 2: Place your hands on the ground in front of you, shoulder-width apart, fingers pointing forward.
Step 3: Extend your legs straight behind you, balancing on your toes and hands, forming a straight line from head to heels.
Step 4: Bend your elbows and lower your upper body towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your hands to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable triceps pushdown (v-bar)
instructions: Step 1: Attach a v-bar attachment to the cable machine at the highest setting.
Step 2: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Grasp the v-bar with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step 4: Keep your elbows close to your sides and your upper arms stationary throughout the exercise.
Step 5: Engage your triceps and exhale as you push the v-bar down until your arms are fully extended.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, squeezing your triceps.
Step 7: Inhale as you slowly return the v-bar to the starting position, maintaining control.
Step 8: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell upright shoulder external rotation
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
Step 2: Raise your arms out to the sides until they are parallel to the ground, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
Step 3: Rotate your arms externally, bringing the dumbbells up towards your head while keeping your elbows in the same position.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable middle fly
instructions: Step 1: Attach cables to both sides of a cable machine at chest height.
Step 2: Stand in the center of the machine with one foot slightly in front of the other.
Step 3: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and extend your arms out to the sides.
Step 4: Keep a slight bend in your elbows and maintain a slight forward lean.
Step 5: Engage your chest muscles and bring your arms forward in a sweeping motion.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the center, then slowly return your arms back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever lying leg curl
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the machine to fit your body and select the desired weight.
Step 2: Lie face down on the machine with your legs straight and your heels against the padded lever.
Step 3: Grasp the handles or the sides of the machine for stability.
Step 4: Keeping your upper body stationary, exhale and curl your legs up as far as possible without lifting your hips off the pad.
Step 5: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your hamstrings.
Step 6: Inhale and slowly lower the lever back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: hyperextension (on bench)
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the hyperextension bench so that your hips are resting comfortably on the pad and your feet are secured.
Step 2: Cross your arms over your chest or place your hands behind your head.
Step 3: Slowly lower your upper body towards the ground while keeping your back straight.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then raise your upper body back up until it is in line with your legs.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell stiff leg good morning
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step 2: Hold the barbell across your upper back, resting it on your traps.
Step 3: Keeping your back straight, hinge forward at the hips, pushing your glutes back.
Step 4: Lower your torso until it is parallel to the ground, feeling a stretch in your hamstrings.
Step 5: Engage your glutes and hamstrings to return to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted crunch
instructions: Step 1: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step 2: Hold a weight plate or dumbbell on your chest.
Step 3: Engage your abs and lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your shoulder blades are off the ground.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: band assisted pull-up
instructions: Step 1: Attach the band to a pull-up bar or sturdy anchor point.
Step 2: Step onto the band and grip the bar with your palms facing away from you, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Hang with your arms fully extended, keeping your core engaged and your shoulders down and back.
Step 4: Pull your body up towards the bar by squeezing your shoulder blades together and driving your elbows down towards your hips.
Step 5: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell romanian deadlift
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
Step 2: Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Bend at the hips, keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent.
Step 4: Lower the barbell towards the ground, keeping it close to your body.
Step 5: Feel the stretch in your hamstrings as you lower the barbell.
Step 6: Once you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, push your hips forward and stand up straight.
Step 7: Squeeze your glutes at the top of the movement.
Step 8: Lower the barbell back down to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell rotation reverse fly
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inwards.
Step 2: Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and chest up.
Step 3: Raise your arms out to the sides, keeping a slight bend in your elbows, until they are parallel to the floor.
Step 4: Rotate your arms so that your palms are facing downwards.
Step 5: Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: tuck crunch
instructions: Step 1: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
Step 2: Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
Step 3: Engaging your abs, lift your shoulder blades off the ground and bring your knees towards your chest, simultaneously curling your upper body towards your knees.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your shoulder blades and extend your legs back to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: reverse grip machine lat pulldown
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the machine with your knees under the pads and your feet flat on the ground.
Step 2: Grasp the handles with an underhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Sit upright with your chest out and shoulders back, maintaining a slight arch in your lower back.
Step 4: Pull the handles down towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell incline t-raise
instructions: Step 1: Set an incline bench to a 45-degree angle and sit on it with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing inwards.
Step 2: Lean forward and let your arms hang straight down, perpendicular to the floor.
Step 3: Keeping your arms straight, raise them out to the sides until they are parallel to the floor, forming a 'T' shape with your body.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable kickback
instructions: Step 1: Stand facing a cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Hold the cable handle with your right hand and step back to create tension in the cable.
Step 3: Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step 4: Keep your upper arm close to your body and your elbow bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step 5: Extend your forearm backward, straightening your arm fully.
Step 6: Pause for a moment, then slowly return to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: barbell high bar squat
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out.
Step 2: Place the barbell on your upper back, resting it on your traps.
Step 3: Engage your core and keep your chest up as you begin to squat down, pushing your hips back and bending your knees.
Step 4: Lower yourself until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
Step 5: Drive through your heels to stand back up, extending your hips and knees.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: ez-barbell standing wide grip biceps curl
instructions: Step 1: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ez barbell with an underhand grip, hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Keep your elbows close to your torso and your upper arms stationary throughout the movement.
Step 3: Curl the barbell up towards your shoulders by contracting your biceps.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever seated crunch
instructions: Step 1: Sit on the leverage machine with your back against the pad and your feet flat on the floor.
Step 2: Grasp the handles or place your hands on the side pads for support.
Step 3: Engage your abs and slowly lean back, allowing the pad to move with you.
Step 4: Once your upper body is at a 45-degree angle, contract your abs and crunch forward, bringing your chest towards your knees.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly release and return to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever reverse grip vertical row
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and footplate position to ensure proper alignment.
Step 2: Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad and your feet flat on the footplate.
Step 3: Grasp the handles with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
Step 4: Keep your back straight and engage your core.
Step 5: Pull the handles towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly release and extend your arms back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: kettlebell front squat
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out.
Step 2: Hold the kettlebell with both hands in front of your chest, close to your body.
Step 3: Engage your core and keep your chest up as you lower your hips down and back, as if sitting into a chair.
Step 4: Lower until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
Step 5: Drive through your heels to stand back up, squeezing your glutes at the top.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell zottman curl
instructions: Step 1: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body.
Step 2: Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate your palms to face forward.
Step 3: Curl the dumbbells up to your shoulders while keeping your upper arms stationary.
Step 4: At the top of the movement, rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing away from your body.
Step 5: Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position, rotating your palms back to facing your body.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: machine inner chest press
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the machine with your back flat against the pad.
Step 2: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and position your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
Step 3: Push the handles forward until your arms are fully extended, exhaling during the movement.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the end of the movement, then slowly return to the starting position, inhaling as you do so.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell one arm bent-over row
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in one hand with your palm facing your body.
Step 2: Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step 3: Let the dumbbell hang straight down towards the floor, with your arm fully extended.
Step 4: Pull the dumbbell up towards your chest, keeping your elbow close to your body and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: reverse crunch
instructions: Step 1: Lie flat on your back with your arms extended along your sides.
Step 2: Bend your knees and lift your feet off the ground, bringing your thighs perpendicular to the floor.
Step 3: Contract your abs and curl your hips off the floor, bringing your knees towards your chest.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell deadlift
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward.
Step 2: Hold a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your body, arms extended downwards.
Step 3: Bend at your hips and knees, lowering the dumbbells towards the ground while keeping your back straight.
Step 4: Push through your heels and extend your hips and knees, lifting the dumbbells back up to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable rope crossover seated row
instructions: Step 1: Sit on the rowing machine with your feet flat on the footrests and your knees slightly bent.
Step 2: Grasp the cable ropes with an overhand grip, palms facing each other.
Step 3: Lean back slightly, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step 4: Pull the cable ropes towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the peak of the movement, then slowly release the tension and return to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: maltese
instructions: Step 1: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight out to the sides.
Step 2: Slowly lean forward, keeping your arms straight, until your upper body is parallel to the ground.
Step 3: Engage your core and hold this position for a few seconds.
Step 4: Return to the starting position by pushing through your feet and standing back up.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell decline pullover
instructions: Step 1: Lie down on a decline bench with your head lower than your hips and your feet secured.
Step 2: Hold the barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing away from you) and your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Extend your arms above your chest, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
Step 4: Lower the barbell in an arc motion behind your head, feeling a stretch in your chest and shoulders.
Step 5: Pause for a moment, then return the barbell to the starting position by reversing the motion.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell seated lateral raise
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and a dumbbell in each hand, resting on your thighs.
Step 2: Keep your back straight and core engaged.
Step 3: Raise the dumbbells to your sides with a slight bend in your elbows, until your arms are parallel to the ground.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: triceps dip (between benches)
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your hands gripping the edge of the bench, fingers pointing forward.
Step 2: Slide your butt off the bench, supporting your weight with your hands.
Step 3: Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back close to the bench.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever bicep curl
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the machine with your back against the pad.
Step 2: Grasp the handles with an underhand grip, palms facing up, and keep your elbows close to your sides.
Step 3: Exhale and curl the handles upward, contracting your biceps.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
Step 5: Inhale and slowly lower the handles back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell standing close grip military press
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly closer than shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Lift the barbell to shoulder height, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step 3: Press the barbell overhead, extending your arms fully.
Step 4: Lower the barbell back to shoulder height.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: ez barbell close grip preacher curl
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a preacher curl bench and place your upper arms on the pad, gripping the ez barbell with an underhand grip.
Step 2: Rest your triceps on the pad and fully extend your arms, keeping your back straight.
Step 3: Slowly curl the barbell towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your biceps.
Step 5: Lower the barbell back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell incline bench press
instructions: Step 1: Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step 2: Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
Step 3: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 4: Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows at a 45-degree angle.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell close-grip press
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, resting on your thighs.
Step 2: Using your thighs to help raise the dumbbells, lift the dumbbells one at a time so that you can hold them in front of you at shoulder width.
Step 3: Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position.
Step 4: As you breathe in, slowly lower the dumbbells to your side until they are about level with your chest.
Step 5: As you exhale, use your triceps to lift the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: hanging straight leg hip raise
instructions: Step 1: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step 2: Engage your core and lift your legs up in front of you until they are parallel to the ground.
Step 3: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step 4: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lying leg raise flat bench
instructions: Step 1: Lie flat on a flat bench with your back pressed against it.
Step 2: Place your hands under your glutes for support.
Step 3: Keep your legs straight and together, and lift them up towards the ceiling.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: one arm dip
instructions: Step 1: Stand facing away from a bench or chair, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Place one hand on the bench or chair behind you, fingers pointing towards your body.
Step 3: Extend your legs out in front of you, keeping your heels on the ground.
Step 4: Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back close to the bench or chair.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your palms to straighten your arms and return to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides and repeat with the other arm.

name: dumbbell close grip press
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand, resting on your thighs.
Step 2: Using your thighs to help raise the dumbbells, lift the dumbbells one at a time so that you can hold them in front of you at shoulder width.
Step 3: Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This will be your starting position.
Step 4: As you breathe in, slowly lower the dumbbells to your side until they are about level with your chest.
Step 5: As you exhale, use your triceps to lift the dumbbells back to the starting position. Make sure to use only your triceps and do not use your forearms or biceps to help lift the dumbbells.
Step 6: After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: bench hip extension
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your back against the bench and your feet flat on the ground.
Step 2: Place your hands on the bench for support.
Step 3: Engage your glutes and hamstrings, then lift your hips off the bench until your body forms a straight line from your knees to your shoulders.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: walk elliptical cross trainer
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the resistance level and incline of the elliptical machine to your desired settings.
Step 2: Step onto the pedals of the machine and grip the handles lightly.
Step 3: Begin by pushing down with your feet and pulling the handles towards your body.
Step 4: Continue this motion, alternating between pushing and pulling, to simulate a walking or running motion.
Step 5: Maintain a steady pace and keep your core engaged throughout the exercise.
Step 6: Continue for the desired duration of your cardio workout.
Step 7: Gradually decrease the intensity and speed of the machine before stepping off.

name: scapular pull-up
instructions: Step 1: Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with your palms facing away from you and your arms fully extended.
Step 2: Retract your shoulder blades by pulling them down and back.
Step 3: Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bar, focusing on squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell incline close grip bench press
instructions: Step 1: Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle.
Step 2: Lie down on the bench with your feet flat on the ground.
Step 3: Grasp the barbell with a close grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.
Step 4: Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step 5: Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest.
Step 6: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable bar lateral pulldown
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the cable pulley to a high position and attach a straight bar.
Step 2: Sit facing the cable machine with your feet flat on the ground and your knees slightly bent.
Step 3: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 4: Lean back slightly and keep your chest up, maintaining a slight arch in your lower back.
Step 5: Pull the bar down towards your chest, leading with your elbows and squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the bottom of the movement, then slowly return the bar to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell lunge
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Step 2: Take a step forward with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge position.
Step 3: Keep your back straight and your chest up as you lower your body.
Step 4: Push through your right heel to return to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat with your left leg.
Step 6: Alternate legs for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith full squat
instructions: Step 1: Set up the smith machine with the barbell at shoulder height.
Step 2: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out.
Step 3: Step under the bar and position it across your upper back, resting on your traps.
Step 4: Grip the bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 5: Unrack the bar and take a step back, maintaining a stable stance.
Step 6: Keeping your chest up and core engaged, initiate the squat by pushing your hips back and bending your knees.
Step 7: Lower your body until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as your flexibility allows.
Step 8: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then drive through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step 9: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: pull up (neutral grip)
instructions: Step 1: Hang from a pull-up bar with a neutral grip (palms facing each other) and your arms fully extended.
Step 2: Engage your core and squeeze your shoulder blades together.
Step 3: Pull your body up towards the bar by bending your elbows and driving your elbows down towards your hips.
Step 4: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position with control.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell incline fly
instructions: Step 1: Set an incline bench to a 45-degree angle.
Step 2: Sit on the bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other.
Step 3: Lie back on the bench and press the dumbbells up to the starting position, directly above your chest.
Step 4: Lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest.
Step 5: Pause for a moment, then squeeze your chest muscles to bring the dumbbells back up to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith back shrug
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Step 2: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Keep your arms straight and allow the barbell to hang in front of your thighs.
Step 4: Lift your shoulders straight up towards your ears, squeezing your traps at the top.
Step 5: Hold for a moment, then lower your shoulders back down to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: inverted row with straps
instructions: Step 1: Set up a suspension trainer or straps at chest height.
Step 2: Stand facing the anchor point and grab the handles with an overhand grip.
Step 3: Walk your feet forward, leaning back until your body is at an angle.
Step 4: Keep your body straight and engage your core.
Step 5: Pull your chest towards the handles, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell standing calf raise
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Step 2: Raise your heels off the ground as high as possible, using your calves.
Step 3: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step 4: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith standing leg calf raise
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the smith machine bar to a height that allows you to stand with your feet flat on the ground and your shoulders under the bar.
Step 2: Position yourself under the bar with your feet shoulder-width apart and your toes pointing forward.
Step 3: Place your hands on the bar for stability.
Step 4: Engage your calves and slowly raise your heels off the ground, lifting your body up onto your toes.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: star jump (male)
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms by your sides.
Step 2: Bend your knees slightly and jump up explosively.
Step 3: As you jump, spread your legs and extend your arms out to the sides, forming a star shape with your body.
Step 4: Land softly on the balls of your feet with your knees slightly bent.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: weighted one hand pull up
instructions: Step 1: Grab the pull-up bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Hang from the bar with your arm fully extended and your body straight.
Step 3: Engage your core and pull your body up towards the bar by bending your elbow and squeezing your back muscles.
Step 4: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step 5: Lower your body back down to the starting position with control.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell curl
instructions: Step 1: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing forward.
Step 2: Keep your elbows close to your torso and exhale as you curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step 3: Continue to raise the bar until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
Step 4: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step 5: Inhale as you slowly begin to lower the bar back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever seated dip
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height so that your feet are flat on the ground and your knees are at a 90-degree angle.
Step 2: Grasp the handles of the leverage machine with your palms facing down and your arms fully extended.
Step 3: Slowly lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Step 4: Pause for a moment, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: incline leg hip raise (leg straight)
instructions: Step 1: Lie on an incline bench with your back flat against the bench and your legs extended straight out in front of you.
Step 2: Place your hands on the sides of the bench for support.
Step 3: Engaging your abs, lift your legs off the bench, raising them as high as you can while keeping them straight.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell straight arm pullover
instructions: Step 1: Lie flat on a bench with your head at one end and your feet planted firmly on the ground.
Step 2: Hold a dumbbell with both hands and extend your arms straight above your chest.
Step 3: Keeping your arms straight, slowly lower the dumbbell behind your head in an arc-like motion.
Step 4: Pause for a moment, then raise the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell goblet squat
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell vertically against your chest with both hands.
Step 2: Keeping your chest up and core engaged, lower your body down into a squat position by pushing your hips back and bending your knees.
Step 3: Continue lowering until your thighs are parallel to the ground, or as low as you can comfortably go.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell decline bench press
instructions: Step 1: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your head lower than your hips.
Step 2: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push the barbell back up to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever assisted chin-up
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the leverage machine to your desired resistance level.
Step 2: Stand on the foot platform and grip the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Hang with your arms fully extended, keeping your body straight.
Step 4: Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the handles, leading with your chest.
Step 5: Continue pulling until your chin is above the handles.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever alternate leg press
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat and foot platform of the leverage machine to your desired position.
Step 2: Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and your feet on the foot platform.
Step 3: Place your hands on the handles or sides of the machine for stability.
Step 4: Push one foot against the foot platform, extending your leg until it is almost fully straight.
Step 5: Pause for a moment, then slowly bend your leg and return to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat with the other leg.
Step 7: Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell seated preacher curl
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a preacher curl bench with your feet flat on the floor.
Step 2: Hold a dumbbell in one hand with an underhand grip, resting your upper arm against the preacher pad.
Step 3: Keeping your upper arm stationary, exhale and curl the dumbbell up towards your shoulder.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

name: weighted front raise
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your thighs.
Step 2: Keeping your arms straight, exhale and lift the dumbbells in front of you until they are at shoulder level.
Step 3: Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position.
Step 4: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: reverse dip
instructions: Step 1: Position yourself between two parallel bars with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step 2: Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the ground.
Step 3: Pause for a moment, then push yourself back up to the starting position by straightening your arms.
Step 4: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell alternate seated hammer curl
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso and arms extended down.
Step 2: Keep your back straight and your elbows close to your torso.
Step 3: Exhale and curl the dumbbell in your right hand towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary.
Step 4: Continue to raise the dumbbell until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbell is at shoulder level.
Step 5: Pause for a brief moment, then inhale and slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat the movement with your left arm.
Step 7: Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.

name: reverse grip pull-up
instructions: Step 1: Grab the pull-up bar with an underhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step 3: Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bar, leading with your chest.
Step 4: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: power clean
instructions: Step 1: Start with the barbell on the ground in front of you, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Bend down and grip the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Keep your back straight and chest up as you lift the barbell off the ground, extending your hips and knees.
Step 4: As the barbell reaches your mid-thigh, explosively pull it upwards, shrugging your shoulders and pulling your elbows high and to the sides.
Step 5: As the barbell reaches its highest point, quickly drop underneath it, rotating your elbows around and catching the barbell on your shoulders in a front squat position.
Step 6: Stand up with the barbell, fully extending your hips and knees.
Step 7: Lower the barbell back down to the starting position, keeping control of the weight throughout the movement.
Step 8: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: forward lunge (male)
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and hands on your hips.
Step 2: Take a big step forward with your right foot, lowering your body into a lunge position.
Step 3: Bend your right knee to about 90 degrees, keeping your knee aligned with your ankle.
Step 4: Push off with your right foot and return to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat with your left leg, alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

name: triceps dip
instructions: Step 1: Sit on the edge of a bench or chair with your hands gripping the edge, fingers pointing forward.
Step 2: Slide your butt off the bench, supporting your weight with your hands.
Step 3: Bend your elbows and lower your body towards the ground, keeping your back close to the bench.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever seated row
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and footrests to a comfortable position.
Step 2: Sit on the machine with your chest against the pad and your feet on the footrests.
Step 3: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, shoulder-width apart.
Step 4: Keep your back straight and your core engaged.
Step 5: Pull the handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the peak of the movement.
Step 7: Slowly release the handles and return to the starting position.
Step 8: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable cross-over variation
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the cable pulleys to chest height.
Step 2: Stand in the center of the cable machine with one foot in front of the other.
Step 3: Grasp the handles with your palms facing down and your arms extended out to the sides.
Step 4: Take a step forward, keeping your arms slightly bent.
Step 5: With a slight bend in your elbows, bring your hands together in front of your chest.
Step 6: Pause for a moment, then slowly return your arms back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell over bench wrist curl
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your forearms resting on the bench and your palms facing up, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Step 2: Allow your wrists to hang over the edge of the bench.
Step 3: Slowly curl your wrists upward, squeezing your forearms at the top of the movement.
Step 4: Pause for a moment, then slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell single leg split squat
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell across your upper back.
Step 2: Take a large step forward with one leg, keeping your torso upright.
Step 3: Lower your body by bending your front knee and hip, while keeping your back leg straight.
Step 4: Continue lowering until your front thigh is parallel to the ground.
Step 5: Pause for a moment, then push through your front heel to return to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.

name: barbell seated overhead press
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step 2: Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Lift the barbell off the rack and bring it to shoulder level, with your elbows bent and palms facing forward.
Step 4: Press the barbell overhead by extending your arms fully.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to shoulder level.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: smith shoulder press
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the smith machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Lift the bar off the rack and position it at shoulder level, with your elbows bent and palms facing forward.
Step 4: Press the bar upward until your arms are fully extended overhead.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the bar back down to shoulder level.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell lying hammer press
instructions: Step 1: Lie flat on a bench with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing each other and arms extended straight up.
Step 2: Lower the dumbbells to the sides of your chest, keeping your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
Step 3: Press the dumbbells back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Step 4: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell one arm kickback
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a dumbbell in your right hand.
Step 2: Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
Step 3: Bring your right elbow up to your side, keeping it bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step 4: Extend your right arm straight back, squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
Step 5: Slowly lower the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

name: dumbbell standing front raise above head
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
Step 2: Keep your arms straight and lift the dumbbells in front of you, raising them above your head.
Step 3: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step 4: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable incline bench row
instructions: Step 1: Set up an incline bench at a 45-degree angle and attach a cable handle to the low pulley.
Step 2: Sit on the bench facing the cable machine with your feet flat on the floor and your knees slightly bent.
Step 3: Grasp the cable handle with an overhand grip and extend your arms fully in front of you.
Step 4: Lean forward from your hips while keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step 5: Pull the cable handle towards your chest by retracting your shoulder blades and bending your elbows.
Step 6: Squeeze your back muscles at the top of the movement, then slowly extend your arms back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever bent over row
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Step 2: Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Bend forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and chest up.
Step 4: Pull the barbell towards your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: barbell standing wide military press
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Step 2: Lift the barbell to shoulder height, keeping your elbows slightly in front of the bar.
Step 3: Press the barbell overhead, extending your arms fully.
Step 4: Lower the barbell back to shoulder height and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: ez barbell seated curls
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
Step 2: Hold the ez barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Rest your upper arms on your thighs, allowing the ez barbell to hang down in front of you.
Step 4: Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the ez barbell upwards towards your shoulders.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your biceps.
Step 6: Inhale and slowly lower the ez barbell back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbells seated triceps extension
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
Step 2: Hold a dumbbell in both hands with an overhand grip, and raise it above your head.
Step 3: Bend your elbows and lower the dumbbell behind your head, keeping your upper arms close to your ears.
Step 4: Extend your arms and raise the dumbbell back to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: hanging pike
instructions: Step 1: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your palms facing away from you.
Step 2: Engage your core and lift your legs up towards the bar, keeping them straight.
Step 3: Continue lifting until your body forms a 'V' shape, with your legs parallel to the ground.
Step 4: Hold the position for a moment, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell biceps curl
instructions: Step 1: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing forward and arms fully extended.
Step 2: Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step 3: Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step 4: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step 5: Inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable straight arm pulldown (with rope)
instructions: Step 1: Attach a rope to the cable machine at the highest setting.
Step 2: Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 3: Grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing down.
Step 4: Extend your arms fully in front of you, keeping your elbows slightly bent.
Step 5: Engage your lats and slowly pull the rope down towards your thighs, keeping your arms straight.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly release the tension and return to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever narrow grip seated row
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and footrests to ensure proper form.
Step 2: Sit on the machine with your feet flat on the footrests and your knees slightly bent.
Step 3: Grasp the handles with a narrow grip, palms facing each other.
Step 4: Keep your back straight and lean slightly forward.
Step 5: Pull the handles towards your torso, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the peak of the movement.
Step 7: Slowly release the handles and return to the starting position.
Step 8: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell seated kickback
instructions: Step 1: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and hold a dumbbell in each hand.
Step 2: Bend your knees slightly and lean forward from your hips, keeping your back straight.
Step 3: Bring your upper arms close to your sides and keep your elbows bent at a 90-degree angle.
Step 4: Extend your arms straight back, squeezing your triceps at the top of the movement.
Step 5: Pause for a moment, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell clean
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, holding a dumbbell in each hand with an overhand grip.
Step 2: Bend your knees and lower your hips into a squat position, keeping your back straight and chest up.
Step 3: Explosively extend your hips and knees, driving through your heels to jump off the ground.
Step 4: As you jump, shrug your shoulders and pull the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, keeping them close to your body.
Step 5: Catch the dumbbells at shoulder height, with your elbows pointing forward and your palms facing up.
Step 6: Lower the dumbbells back down to the starting position by reversing the movement.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever seated reverse fly
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the machine with your chest against the pad and your feet flat on the floor.
Step 2: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and keep your arms slightly bent.
Step 3: Exhale and squeeze your shoulder blades together as you pull the handles back and outward, away from your body.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the peak contraction, then inhale and slowly return to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: world greatest stretch
instructions: Step 1: Start in a lunge position with your right foot forward and your left foot back.
Step 2: Place your hands on the ground on either side of your right foot.
Step 3: Lower your left knee to the ground and extend your right leg, keeping your right foot flat on the ground.
Step 4: Rotate your torso to the right, reaching your right arm up towards the ceiling.
Step 5: Hold this position for a few seconds, then return to the starting position.
Step 6: Switch sides and repeat the stretch with your left foot forward.

name: lever incline chest press
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the seat and backrest of the leverage machine to a comfortable position.
Step 2: Sit on the machine with your back against the backrest and your feet flat on the floor.
Step 3: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and position your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 4: Push the handles forward and away from your body until your arms are fully extended.
Step 5: Pause for a moment, then slowly bend your elbows and lower the handles back towards your chest.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable curl
instructions: Step 1: Stand facing the cable machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Grasp the cable attachment with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
Step 3: Keep your elbows close to your sides and your upper arms stationary.
Step 4: Exhale and curl the cable attachment towards your shoulders, contracting your biceps.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your biceps.
Step 6: Inhale and slowly lower the cable attachment back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: ez barbell spider curl
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the ez barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
Step 2: Rest your upper arms on a preacher bench or stability ball, allowing your elbows to hang down.
Step 3: Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the barbell up towards your shoulders.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your biceps.
Step 5: Inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: clap push up
instructions: Step 1: Start in a high plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows, keeping your core engaged.
Step 3: Push through your palms explosively to propel your body off the ground.
Step 4: While in mid-air, clap your hands together before landing back in the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell hammer curl
instructions: Step 1: Stand up straight with a dumbbell in each hand, palms facing your torso.
Step 2: Keep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward.
Step 3: This will be your starting position.
Step 4: Now, keeping the upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
Step 5: Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fully contracted and the dumbbells are at shoulder level.
Step 6: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
Step 7: Then, inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step 8: Repeat for the recommended amount of repetitions.

name: rear pull-up
instructions: Step 1: Grab the pull-up bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Hang from the bar with your arms fully extended and your body straight.
Step 3: Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bar, keeping your elbows close to your body.
Step 4: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
Step 5: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
Step 6: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: lever standing calf raise
instructions: Step 1: Adjust the machine to your height and stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Step 2: Place your shoulders under the pads and hold onto the handles for stability.
Step 3: Raise your heels as high as possible by extending your ankles.
Step 4: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
Step 5: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: dumbbell rear delt row_shoulder
instructions: Step 1: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and knees slightly bent.
Step 2: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing your body.
Step 3: Bend forward at the waist, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Step 4: Extend your arms straight down towards the floor, with a slight bend in your elbows.
Step 5: Raise the dumbbells out to the sides, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Step 6: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.
Step 7: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: cable reverse wrist curl
instructions: Step 1: Attach a cable to a low pulley and sit on a bench facing the cable machine.
